exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H2053.def: = a piece of curved metal ► for attaching curtains to pillars

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H5982.def: = a tall, vertical structure ◄ made of metal, stone, or wood ► and used as support for a building or for decoration

H7848.def: = a desert tree, reaching a height of 3-5 m, with a wide crown; it has sharp spines, finely divided leaves, and tiny pale yellow flowers arranged in drooping bunches; it produces a bean pod that is twisted and looped when dry; ◄ a member of the Mimosa family, Acacia tortilis or Acacia raddiana; ► its wood is used for construction

H6823.def: = action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H134.def: = heavy object with a flat bottom and, in some cases, a hole in its top; ◄ made of stone or metal; ► used as support for a {L:pillar<SDBH:עַמּוּד>} or a {L:wooden frame<SDBH:קֶרֶשׁ>}, to keep it from falling and/or sinking into the ground

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6532.def: = a relatively large piece of cloth, woven by a craftsman with costly materials, ► separating the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place in the sanctuary, and covering the Ark of the Covenant when it was being moved

H7165.def: = a piece of curved metal ► used for joining pieces of cloth together or for attaching them to another object

H727.def: = relatively large wooden box ► used for storage

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H914.def: = action by which part of an entity is separated from the rest, either by detaching it completely it or by creating a kind of barrier (visible or invisible) between the selected part and the rest of the entity

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

glosses: cover, lid (of the ark of the covenant)
H3727.def: = a flat, rectangular object with two golden figures with wings on its top, made out of hammered gold, ► and used to cover the {L:Covenant Box<SDBH:אֲרֹון>}, which represented the presence of YHWH among his people; this is also the place where, once a year, on the Day of Atonement, blood from sacrificial animals was sprinkled; ≈ associated with atonement

H727.def: = relatively large wooden box ► used for storage

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

10.gl: cover, lid (of the ark of the covenant)

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7979.def: literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H6532.def: = a relatively large piece of cloth, woven by a craftsman with costly materials, ► separating the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place in the sanctuary, and covering the Ark of the Covenant when it was being moved

H6828.def: = a mountain, identified with Jebel ʾel-Aqraʿ ◄ in northern Syria, ► known by the Canaanites as the mountain of the gods

H6763.def: = each of a series of slender curved bones attached in pairs to the spine, protecting the thoracic cavity and its organs

H4908.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

H4501.def: = stand ► designed to hold one or more lamps so that the lamps can light a large area

H5227.def: = state in which an object is located on the other side of an object or area

H8486.def: = area located to the south of a point of reference

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4539.def: = a relatively large piece of cloth, ► used to close off the entrance to (part of) a tent, or, more generally, as a covering

H7551.def: = person whose profession it is to sew decorative patterns into cloth

H8504.def: = woven material, dyed reddish-purple with a substance obtained from the murex shellfish

H713.def: = woven material, dyed reddish-purple with a substance obtained from the murex shellfish

H7806.def: = process by which fibres are spun into a thread with the help of a {L:spindle<SDBH:כִּישֹׁור>}

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H8336.def: = state in which a countable entity is six in number

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2568.def: = state in which a countable entity is five in number

H4539.def: = a relatively large piece of cloth, ► used to close off the entrance to (part of) a tent, or, more generally, as a covering

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H2053.def: = a piece of curved metal ► for attaching curtains to pillars

H3332.def: = process by which liquids flow from one place to another

H5178.def: = a reddish-brown metal, ◄ mined from the hills, ► and used, together with {L:tin<SDBH:בְּדִיל>}, for the production of bronze
